hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive

Class Join<Left,Right,LeftDuration,RightDuration,Result>

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.util.Producer<Result>
      • hu.akarnokd.reactive4java.reactive.Join<Left,Right,LeftDuration,RightDuration,Result>
  • Type Parameters:
    Left - the element type of the left stream
    Right - the element type of the right stream
    LeftDuration - the overlapping duration indicator for the left stream (e.g., the event when it leaves)
    RightDuration - the overlapping duration indicator for the right stream (e.g., the event when it leaves)
    Result - the type of the grouping based on the coincidence.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable<Result>

    public class Join<Left,Right,LeftDuration,RightDuration,Result>
extends Producer<Result>
    Correlates elements of two sequences based on overlapping durations.

    Windows are terminated by either a next() or finish call from the duration observables.

    Since:
    0.97
    Author:
    akarnokd, 2013.01.16.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        protected Closeable run(Observer<? super Result> observer,
            Closeable cancel,
            Action1<Closeable> setSink)
        Description copied from class: Producer
        The core implementation of the operator, called upon registration to the producer.

        Note that the observer is not automatically detached in case of error or finish cases. Implementations should ensure proper termination.

        Specified by:
        run in class Producer<Result>
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer to send notifications on
        cancel - the cancellation handler from the run() call, allows self cancellations
        setSink - communicates the sink to the registering party which allows consumers to tunnel close calls into the sink, which can stop processing
        Returns:
        the closeable representing all resources and/or registrations to cancel at once.
